New Records: The referee set a new Euros record with 18 cards, including two reds and 16 yellows.
Key Match Events: Czechia's Antonín Barák was sent off with a harsh second yellow card in the 20th minute.
Tomás Chorý received a red card at the final whistle in a melee.
Hakan Çalhanoglu scored Turkey's first goal with a low shot across goalkeeper Jindrich Stanek.
Arda Güler missed a sitter that would have put Turkey two ahead.
Tomás Soucek equalized for Czechia with a 66th-minute goal after a long throw.
Cenk Tosun scored Turkey's winner in stoppage time.
Post-Match Reflections: Czechia captain Tomás Soucek expressed disappointment, citing the 'disrespectful' soft red card.
Turkey defender Mert Muldur praised the team's effort and improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match had a chaotic end with multiple cards and reds.
Turkey's win marked their first Euro 2020 victory after a poor run.
The game was played in front of a large Turkish diaspora in Germany.
